intro: Gouania mauritiana var. angustiloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaf gouania, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and conservation efforts.
